summary: The document is a statement from the University of New Mexico, School of Medicine, Office of the Medical Investigator, detailing the preparation and associated costs of a report for the Forensic Pathology Panel to the Select Committee on Assassinations, U.S. House of Representatives. It includes administrative details, the document's origin, date, classification, and specifics about the preparation costs, such as printing and postage expenses. The document also lists individuals involved in the report's preparation, including their Social Security numbers for identification purposes, and notes its current status as redacted with the date of its last review.
key_findings: The document is associated with the HSCA (House Select Committee on Assassinations) and pertains to the JFK assassination investigation.
It details the costs associated with preparing a report for the Forensic Pathology Panel, including printing and postage expenses.
The document lists individuals involved in the preparation of the report, along with their Social Security numbers, which was a common practice at the time for identification purposes.
The document is marked as unclassified and open in full, with a note on its current status being redacted and the date of its last review.
